product_specification.Sales Package: Pad, Charger, Data Cable, User Manual

product_description.Slim and Light-weight Design: The sleek and seamless metal exterior design offers style and elegance to this realme Pad 3 tablet. Also, the lightweight body of around 440 g makes it convenient to hold and sturdy to use.
product_description.Immersive Display: Featuring a 26.31 cm (10.4) WUXGA+ Immersive display with a Razor-thin bezel, this tablet offers an immersive viewing experience. Also, its 82.5% screen-to-body ratio and 2000 x 1200 resolution is designed to provide true-to-life visuals.

As for bloatware there ain't any and there is hardly any ads. Camera is okay for scanning documents and stuff but not that great for other things. Front camera quality is great for video calls. Battery life is good enough for everyday usage. With moderate usage will last you for a whole day and even then you'll be left with more than 30% battery. Well I'm satisfied with my purchase.

I've used this tablet for 5 days. Here is what I found:
First things first. It comes with No bloatware which is pretty good. Just some Google apps are pre-installed.
Display is very good. It's slightly better than FHD. Brightness is good for indoor work but for outdoors it's not sufficient.
Speakers are the best part of this tablet. It has Dolby Atmos support and has quad speakers which easily fill up the room. You will surely love it!
Performace is surprisingly better than expected. It comes packed with Helio G80 chipset which you find in 10k range phones. I played Pubg (low ultra settings) and Asphalt. Didn't get any lag as such.
Coming to UI. It's realme UI optimised for pad. It good but still need some work. Also, gestures can be improved.

Summary:
Best tab under 20k as of now. Go for it blindly for entertainment and education purposes. Wouldn't recommend it for heavy gaming.

This is a value for money tablet. Ideal or Kids' Online classes
Touch is responsive unlike many other cheaper tablets.
Sound is good from Quad speakers. Kids can listen to their teachers very well and good for watching movies too.
Since it is coming with near stock Android 11, it has an inbuilt video recorder in case you would like to record kids classes. I found the recording to stop automatically after running for quite some time though. Also, sometimes I noticed that you have to restart tablet to start rcording again. May be a future software update wil patch it.
It supports Multiple users. So you can have an separate users created for adultsand kids and the appliocation settings wont be shared. You can also keep a track of the kids account using Goglr Family link by controlling the screen time and allow only kids safe applications. Family link Admin has to approve the playstore App installs not hitelisted for kids while using the kids user account.
Also supports google kids space for the kids accounts for better suggestion of Apps for kids. I was not comfortable with the user interface of kids space . So disabled it after installing necessary apps. Installed apps can stay.
